entries.title: Twitter Reinstates Some Accounts of Suspended Journalists
entries.description: Elon Musk said he would lift the suspensions based on the results of a Twitter survey that asked users whether he should keep the accounts offline for a week or reinstate them immediately.

entries.title: Microsoft Prepares to Go to Battle With FTC Over Activision Deal
entries.description: The software company says the deal “is fundamentally good for gamers” and wouldn’t threaten competition in the industry.

entries.title: These Parents Use Baby Monitors to Track Older Children---Even Teens
entries.description: Doctors say keeping cameras or listening devices in kids’ bedrooms can ruin everyone’s sleep. How to wean yourself and your kids off them.

entries.title: Could the Key to Widespread EV Adoption Be Less Range?
entries.description: Battery packs that could charge in the same amount of time it takes to fill up at a gas station could be key to making electric vehicles more affordable than gas cars.

entries.title: TuSimple Plans Layoffs
entries.description: The self-driving trucking company plans to cut potentially at least half of its workforce next week, as it scales back efforts to build and test autonomous truck-driving systems.

entries.title: Elon Musk Seeks Additional Funds for Twitter
entries.description: Ross Gerber, a shareholder in Twitter and Tesla, says he has been approached to put more money into the social-media platform.
